name: bowtie2-build

options.description: reference sequences given on cmd line (as <reference_in>)
force generated index to be 'large', even if ref has fewer than 4 billion nucleotides
use the debug binary; slower, assertions enabled
use sanitized binary; slower, uses ASan and/or UBSan
use packed strings internally; slower, less memory
max bucket sz for blockwise suffix-array builder
max bucket sz as divisor of ref len (default: 4)
SA is sampled every 2^<int> BWT chars (default: 5)
# of chars consumed in initial lookup (default: 10)

positionalArguments.name: reference_in
positionalArguments.description: comma-separated list of files with ref sequences

positionalArguments.name: bt2_index_base
positionalArguments.description: write bt2 data to files with this dir/basename

tldr:
> A fast and sensitive gapped read aligner
> More information: <https://github.com/BenLangmead/bowtie2>

- Build a small index

`bowtie2-build {{example/reference/lambda_virus.fa}} {{example/index/lambda_virus}}`

- Build a large index

`bowtie2-build --large-index {{example/reference/lambda_virus.fa}} {{example/index/lambda_virus}}`
